title: Anuar Tuhami
text:
Anuar Mohamed Tuhami (born 15 January 1995), simply known as Anuar, is a <a href="Moroccan%20people">Moroccan</a> professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="Midfielder%23Central%20midfielder">central midfielder</a> for Spanish club <a href="Real%20Valladolid">Real Valladolid</a>. Born in Spain, Anuar represents the <a href="Morocco%20national%20football%20team">Morocco national football team</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Ceuta">Ceuta</a>, Anuar finished his formation at <a href="Real%20Valladolid">Real Valladolid</a>, and made his senior debuts with <a href="Real%20Valladolid%20B">the reserves</a> in the <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Tercera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">2012–13 campaign</a> in <a href="Tercera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Tercera División</a>, aged only 17.
Anuar made his first-team debut on 15 October 2014, <a href="Substitute%20%28association%20football%29">replacing</a> <a href="%C3%81lvaro%20Rubio">Álvaro Rubio</a> in the 77th minute of a 2–0 home win over <a href="Girona%20FC">Girona FC</a> for <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Copa%20del%20Rey">the season</a>'s <a href="Copa%20del%20Rey">Copa del Rey</a>. He made his <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Segunda División</a> debut on 1 May 2016, coming on as a substitute for <a href="Vincenzo%20Rennella">Vincenzo Rennella</a> in a 1–1 home draw against <a href="CD%20Lugo">CD Lugo</a>.
On 12 November 2017, after becoming a regular starter under new manager <a href="Luis%20C%C3%A9sar%20Sampedro">Luis César Sampedro</a>, Anuar renewed his contract until 2020. He scored his first professional goal on 19 December, netting the first in a 3–2 home win against <a href="Real%20Zaragoza">Real Zaragoza</a>.
Anuar contributed with one goal in 29 appearances (<a href="2018%20Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20play-offs">play-offs included</a>) as his side achieved promotion to <a href="La%20Liga">La Liga</a>. He made his debut in the main category of Spanish football on 17 August 2018, starting in a 0–0 away draw against <a href="Girona%20FC">Girona</a>.
On 13 January 2020, Anuar joined <a href="Superleague%20Greece">Superleague Greece</a> side <a href="Panathinaikos%20F.C.">Panathinaikos</a> on a six-month loan contract. On 7 September, he switched teams and countries again after agreeing to a one-year loan deal with <a href="APOEL%20FC">APOEL FC</a> of the <a href="Cypriot%20First%20Division">Cypriot First Division</a>.
International career.
Born in Spain, Anuar is of Moroccan descent. He represented the <a href="Morocco%20national%20football%20team">Morocco national football team</a> in a 1–1 friendly tie with <a href="Burkina%20Faso%20national%20football%20team">Burkina Faso</a> on 6 September 2019.
